org.huldra.math

Class BigInt

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • org.huldra.math.BigInt
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<BigInt>

    public class BigInt
extends Number
implements Comparable<BigInt>

    A class for arbitrary-precision integer arithmetic purely written in Java.

    This class does what BigInteger doesn't.
    It is faster, and it is mutable!
    It supports ints and longs as parameters!
    It has a way faster toString() method!
    It utilizes a faster multiplication algorithm for those nasty big numbers!

    Get it today! Because performance matters (and we like Java).

    Version:
    0.7
    Author:
    Simon Klein
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BigInt

        public BigInt(int sign,
      int[] v,
      int len)
        Creates a BigInt from the given parameters. The input-array will be used as is and not be copied.
        Parameters:
        sign - The sign of the number.
        v - The magnitude of the number, the first position gives the least significant 32 bits.
        len - The (first) number of entries of v that are considered part of the number.
        Complexity
        O(1)

      • BigInt

        public BigInt(int sign,
      int val)
        Creates a BigInt from the given parameters. The input-value will be interpreted as unsigned.
        Parameters:
        sign - The sign of the number.
        val - The magnitude of the number.
        Complexity
        O(1)

      • byteValue

        public byte byteValue()
        Returns this BigInt as a byte.
        Overrides:
        byteValue in class Number
        Returns:
        sign * (this & 0x7F)

      • shortValue

        public short shortValue()
        Returns this BigInt as a short.
        Overrides:
        shortValue in class Number
        Returns:
        sign * (this & 0x7FFF)

      • intValue

        public int intValue()
        Returns this BigInt as an int.
        Specified by:
        intValue in class Number
        Returns:
        sign * (this & 0x7FFFFFFF)

      • longValue

        public long longValue()
        Returns this BigInt as a long.
        Specified by:
        longValue in class Number
        Returns:
        sign * (this & 0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF)

      • floatValue

        public float floatValue()
        Returns this BigInt as a float.
        Specified by:
        floatValue in class Number
        Returns:
        the most significant 24 bits in the mantissa (the highest order bit obviously being implicit), the exponent value which will be consistent for BigInts up to 128 bits (should it not fit it'll be calculated modulo 256), and the sign bit set if this number is negative.

      • doubleValue

        public double doubleValue()
        Returns this BigInt as a double.
        Specified by:
        doubleValue in class Number
        Returns:
        the most significant 53 bits in the mantissa (the highest order bit obviously being implicit), the exponent value which will be consistent for BigInts up to 1024 bits (should it not fit it'll be calculated modulo 2048), and the sign bit set if this number is negative.

      • mul

        public void mul(BigInt mul)
        Multiplies this number by the given BigInt. Chooses the appropriate algorithm with regards to the size of the numbers.
        Parameters:
        mul - The number to multiply with.
        Complexity
        O(n^2) - O(n log n)

      • smallMul

        public void smallMul(BigInt mul)
        Multiplies this number by the given (suitably small) BigInt. Uses a quadratic algorithm which is often suitable for smaller numbers.
        Parameters:
        mul - The number to multiply with.
        Complexity
        O(n^2)

      • karatsuba

        public void karatsuba(BigInt mul)
        Multiplies this number by the given BigInt using the Karatsuba algorithm.
        Parameters:
        mul - The number to multiply with.
        Complexity
        O(n^1.585)

      • karatsuba

        public void karatsuba(BigInt mul,
             boolean parallel)
        Multiplies this number by the given BigInt using the Karatsuba algorithm. The caller can choose to use a parallel version which is more suitable for larger numbers.
        Parameters:
        mul - The number to multiply with.
        parallel - true if we should try to parallelize the algorithm, false if we shouldn't.
        Complexity
        O(n^1.585)

      • div

        public void div(BigInt div)
        Divides this number by the given BigInt. Division by zero is undefined.
        Parameters:
        div - The number to divide with.
        Complexity
        O(n^2)

      • rem

        public void rem(BigInt div)
        Sets this number to the remainder r satisfying q*div + r = this, where q = floor(this/div).
        Parameters:
        div - The number to use in the division causing the remainder.
        Complexity
        O(n^2)

      • divRem

        public BigInt divRem(BigInt div)
        Divides this number by the given BigInt and returns the remainder. Division by zero is undefined.
        Parameters:
        div - The number to divide with.
        Returns:
        The remainder.
        Complexity
        O(n^2)

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Converts this number into a string of radix 10.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        The string representation of this number in decimal.
        Complexity
        O(n^2)
